title: BBC Local Live: Devon and Cornwall on Wednesday 3 January 2018 - BBC News
summary: 'hundreds of tonnes ' fall in portreath harbour wall crash .
perranporth bistro damaged by dirty water and debris .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: live updates for devon and cornwall have finished for the day , but we 'll be back at 06:00 on thursday with the latest news , sport , travel and that all-important weather as the region endures the last of the effects of storm eleanor .
do n't forget spotlight on bbc one later .
there will also be news through the night on your bbc local radio station .
you can sign up to get the latest news for your area from the bbc .

documents.title: 'it 's going to be a long night '
text: the owner of one of the beach side properties in portreath thought to be at risk of flooding says she is scared more damage could be done .
sandra lute lets the house out , and has just arrived in the village from her home in brixham .
she said : `` i 'm frightened , terrified to be honest .
it 's going to be a long night . ''
high tide has now passed and a decision will be made on whether to evacuate the properties for the next high tide tomorrow morning .
author: Johnny O'Shea
BBC News Online

documents.title: warning for portreath residents for morning tide
text: people in cornwall are asked to stay away from the coastline at high tide tomorrow morning as gales and spring tides collide again .
people living on portreath 's seafront were asked to leave their homes by cornwall council during this evening 's high tide .
it comes after about 20m ( 60ft ) of the harbour wall collapsed as a result of storm eleanor .

documents.title: power cut in perranporth affecting 349 properties
text: western power distribution says it hopes all supplies will be restored by 19:30 .
we are aware of a # powercut in the # perranporth # tr6 and surrounding area .
we aim to restore all supplies by 19:30 .
andi
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: rescue team and volunteers patrol portreath sea wall
text: portreath coastguard rescue team and flood volunteers have been patrolling the sea wall at porteath .
about 40 people watched the waves crash in the darkness at high tide .
there is no sign of anyone evacuating properties along the beach and the rescue team are confident none have flooded .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: high tide bursts through wall but properties safe
text: as high tide hit in portreath , some waves burst through the hole that developed in the sea wall last night .
about 40 people are watching events unfold , a combination of local residents and emergency service staff .
a member of the portreath coastguard rescue team said he has been watching closely and is confident none of the properties along the beach have flooded .
a sand bank has been built up during the day to offer added protection and , so far , appears to have done its job .
author: Johnny O'Shea
BBC News Online

documents.title: 'we look out for each other ' in portreath
text: these two men arrived at the church hall in portreath to ask if they could help in any way .
residents in at-risk properties - due to the breaching of the sea wall and the high tide at 18:09 - were urged by the council to leave their homes and go to the hall for safety .
owen hodge ( left ) , 30 , said : `` we finished work and came to ask if we could help in any way , people moving house , lifting stuff , anything really . ''
his friend , tom goldring , 29 , also a portreath resident said : `` there 's been flooding here before and there 's been a bit of a scramble so we said we would be happy to help .
this is a strong community , we look out for each other . ''
author: Johnny O'Shea
BBC News Online

documents.title: people 'in danger ' by standing too close to sea wall
text: people are `` putting themselves in danger '' by standing too close to the sea wall in perranporth , perranporth community fire station has said .
with high tide expected there at 18:09 , waves are already breaching the sea wall near the car park in beach road , the fire station added .
people are being advised to watch from a `` safe distance '' .
high tide is forecast for 18:09 tonight at perranporth .
the waves are already breaching the sea wall near the car park on beach road .
people are already putting themselves at danger by being far to close to the edge .
move back and watch from a safe distance
author: Hayley Westcott
BBC News Online

documents.title: new group to help flood victims
text: a community flood group for portreath was formed just last month , and this is their first real operation .
it 's made up of local volunteers , to try to help the village that is known as being at risk of flooding .
having met in the st mary 's church hall they have now moved to the harbour side to offer advice and support to residents .
author: Johnny O'Shea
BBC News Online

documents.title: about 40 cornwall properties still without power
text: western power distribution is still working to restore power to about 40 properties in cornwall after storm eleanor hit the county .
@ wpduk says around 40 properties remain without power in cornwall following last nights storms .
author: Twitter

documents.title: waiting game in portreath
text: people living in beach sidebar houses in portreath are anxiously waiting to see what damage high tide will do this evening .
with a 20m ( 60ft ) hole in the sea wall it 's feared up to 20 properties could be at risk of flooding .
cornwall councillor and village resident joyce duffin said : `` we are waiting to see how the wall reacts tonight beforehand deciding on a course of action for tomorrow . ''
high tide is at 18:10 .
author: Johnny O'Shea
BBC News Online

documents.title: storm eleanor brings 'strongest winds for several years '
text: storm eleanor , whilst a long way away from the sw , still generated storm force winds for us and the combination of spring tides , low pressure , and severe gales , allowed the sea to come up much higher than normal and resulted in some coastal flooding .
previous big storms have had more impact and stronger gusts but last night and this morning we had some of the strongest winds for several years .
previous gusts :
author: David Braine
Weather Forecaster

documents.title: winds and tides 'not a great combination ' warning
text: people in cornwall are being reminded to stay away from exposed coastal locations because some met office weather warnings for wind are still in place .
cornwall council said people should be careful , especially during tonight 's high tide and thursday 's morning 's spring tide .
those are due , depending on location , between 17:30 in the far west and 19:00 in the east this evening , and 05:50 in the far west and 07:20 in the east on thursday morning .
`` strong winds and high tides are not a great combination , '' it said .
the environment agency has flood warnings for the north coast and flood alerts for the south coast .
alan burrows , from the agency , said its staff were preparing for `` another busy night '' .
author: Andrew Segal
BBC Local Live

documents.title: cornwall council deals with 40 fallen trees and flooding
text: cornwall council says its staff and those from contractor cormac have dealt with more than 40 fallen trees and localised surface water flooding throughout the county in the aftermath of storm eleanor .
it added most of the work today had been in portreath following the collapse of a harbour wall to the western side of the village 's main car park in the early hours of wednesday .

it said a section of the car park was closed and crews had been clearing debris from the collapsed wall and were will remain on site during tonight 's high tide at about 18:10 and ahead of thursday morning 's spring tide at about 06:30 .
author: Andrew Segal
BBC Local Live

documents.title: police negotiators called out to plymouth 'altercation '
text: a man from plymouth has been arrested after an incident in the city where police were called to reports of an altercation .
several police vehicles , officers in riot gear and negotiators were called to the scene on salcombe road at about 10:00 .
no one was injured .
a 22-year-old man is in police custody .
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: weather : rain overnight , easing on thursday , but windy
text: rain will quickly push in from the west this evening , with some heavy bursts and strong winds .
minimum temperature : 7c ( 45f ) .
after a wet start to thursday , rain will ease through the morning to leave some bright spells .
however , it will be a windy day for many .
maximum temperature : 13c ( 55f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: portreath harbour : 'biggest damage i 've seen in 35 years '
text: a portreath resident who lives near a harbour wall that was damaged by storm eleanor says he is `` concerned '' at what has happened .
about 20m ( 60ft ) of the harbour wall collapsed overnight and the environment agency has identified 20 houses that could be at risk with the wall in its current state .
council officials have been knocking on doors , asking people to go to a local church hall between 17:00 and 19:00 .
simon gregor said : `` i started getting texts at about 08:00 to see if i was ok .
i pulled back the curtains and there was this scene of devastation . ''
he has lived in his house for the past 35 years .
he said : `` i 've seen storms every year but this is the biggest damage i 've ever seen .
`` it 's the joy of living next to the beach .
i 've never come too close to being flooded , so i feel reasonably safe .
but i am concerned . ''
author: Miles Davis
BBC News Online

documents.title: sutton harbour holdings ' future secured : analysis
text: a deal to secure the future of the plymouth-based regeneration company sutton harbour holdings has won overwhelming shareholder support .
the deal , approved at a meeting today , will see most of the business , which has had a problem with debt , bought by an investment company led by a canadian architect .
this deal , which is now a fait accompli , keeps sutton habour 's existing management in place , and maintains pressure for redevelopment of plymouth 's closed airport site (

a proposed 10-storey block of flats and restaurants on plymouth 's waterfront will take a step closer to reality once the deal is completed , thanks to a cash injection that addresses the group 's problem with debt .
some shareholders told me they were sad that solutions to the debt problem could not be found from within the south west business community .
none that i spoke to after the meeting - from which journalists were excluded - were opposed to the deal .
author: Neil Gallacher, Business & Industry Correspondent
BBC Spotlight

documents.title: more than 110 properties in cornwall still without power
text: western power distribution is continuing to try to restore power to properties across cornwall after damage caused by storm eleanor .
some 116 properties across the county are understood to be without electricity .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: engineers to observe tide to see how sea wall was breached
text: people in portreath are being advised to leave their homes during high tide tonight .
it comes after 20m ( 60ft ) of the harbour wall collapsed during storm eleanor overnight .
the environment agency has identified 20 houses that could be at risk with the wall in its current state .
council officials are knocking on doors , asking people to go to a local church hall between 17:00 and 19:00 .
joyce duffin , who represents the area on cornwall council , and is also the local flood plan coordinator , said engineers were looking at the situation to figure out how to begin repairs .
she said : `` without having seen what happened , it 's hard to know what occurred : whether it was the wind , whether it was the way the waves were .
`` we 're hoping [ this evening ] to get a bit more of an idea , and it will help to know whether we should evacuate houses tomorrow morning before the high tide . ''
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: man arrested after 'racially-aggravated assault on pcso '
text: police say a man has been arrested after an alleged racially-aggravated assault on a police community support officer in truro .
witnesses said they saw four police vehicles on lemon quay during the incident .
the pcso was unharmed .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: hospital sees 4 % increase in 'urgent ' christmas patients
text: a cornish hospital has recorded a 4 % increase in `` emergency and urgent care attenders '' over the busy christmas period .
a spokesman from the royal cornwall hospital trust said their `` winter plan '' meant the rise was being dealt with by `` pacing non-urgent patients appropriately and prioritising urgent care '' .
the trust has asked members of the community to seek medical advice early and choose alternatives to a & e when possible .

documents.title: man knocked unconscious in plymouth nightclub assault
text: police in plymouth are investigating an assault in a city nightclub that left a man unconscious .
officers said the attack took place near a revolving dance floor in popworld , on union street , at about 01:55 on friday 29 december .
a 24-year-old local man was punched by another man , causing him to fall down and hit his head on a metal bar .
he was knocked unconscious and treated in hospital for concussion .
police have appealed for witnesses .
author: Andrew Segal
BBC Local Live

documents.title: high tide monitoring 'to determine what happens next '
text: teams from cornwall council are to monitor high tide in portreath at about 18:00 this evening to help determine what action should be taken after a sea wall breach .
about 20m ( 65ft ) of sea wall has been damaged as a result of storm eleanor .
people whose homes are at risk from flooding after the harbour wall was breached have been advised to go to a local church hall during the evening high tide .
a letter from cornwall council to affected residents said : `` what happens following the high tide this evening will determine the next steps . ''
the letter added : `` in the event that there is flooding which affects your home , you may wish to consider making arrangements to stay with friends or family overnight . ''
it also said the gwel an mor holiday complex had offered to help anyone who could not arrange alternative accommodation .
author: Andrew Segal
BBC Local Live

documents.title: 'go to hall at high tide ' request to portreath residents
text: people whose homes are at risk from flooding after a harbour wall in cornwall was breached by storm eleanor have been advised to go to a local church hall during the evening high tide .
about 20m ( 65ft ) of sea wall has been damaged in portreath .
a letter from cornwall council to affected residents warns `` there is a possibility that some homes in portreath will be at risk of flooding this evening and tomorrow morning '' .
residents have been advised to go to st mary 's church hall between 17:00 and 19:00 , coinciding with the high tide tonight which is about 18:10 .
teams from the council are due to `` be on site to monitor how the situation progresses and give further advice '' .
author: Andrew Segal
BBC Local Live

documents.title: fire crew call out caused by burning books
text: fire crews have made safe a property which was `` smoke-logged '' from burning books .
devon and somerset fire and rescue service received a call reporting concerns of smoke in the budleigh salterton property .
on arrival the officer in charge found the disturbance was due to books sitting in contact with a desk lamp .
the room was ventilated and made safe .

documents.title: deal approved to secure future of sutton harbour holdings
text: a deal to secure the future of the plymouth-based regeneration company sutton harbour holdings has won overwhelming shareholder support .
the deal will see most of the business , which has had a problem with debt , bought by an investment company led by a canadian architect .
the shareholders voting in favour of the deal own 83 % of the company .
the deal was approved by them at a shareholder meeting in plymouth this morning .
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: cliff concerns at crantock after storms
text: engineers are in portreath assessing how to make the harbour wall safe after a 20m section was damaged by storm eleanor .
storm damage has also raised concerns at crantock , near newquay , where part of the beach has become unstable .
parish councillor ben dobson said he was worried about public safety
he said : `` we 've had these storms over the past couple of days and we have got sand dune cliffs over 30ft high .
`` a new section of cliff has emerged , with rocks falling over the place , and the whole of the main face of the beach has just dramatically changed . ''
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: former exeter youngster lines up glasgow rangers move
text: former exeter city youngster sean goss is undergoing a medical ahead of a potential loan move to glasgow rangers .
the 22-year-old , who is currently with queens park rangers , left manchester united in january 2017 but has made only six appearances for the championship club .
he would become the first signing under graeme murty since he was confirmed as rangers manager until the end of the season .
goss joined manchester united in 2012 from exeter city 's youth academy and can play in midfield or defence .
author: Brent Pilnick
BBC Sport

documents.title: storm eleanor : why are high tides causing concern ?
text: high tides have been causing concern on the north coast of devon and cornwall because of the effect storm eleanor might have on them .
although the storm is heading across the north sea , the next high tide , between 17:15 and 19:00 across the north coast of both counties , could still bring problems .

when you 've got got such large surfaces of water potentially so close to some people 's homes and businesses , the concern is that an increase in tide of just a few inches can produce huge volumes of overtopping water and prove devastating .
in portreath , there is the added problem that sea defences were breached when a section of harbour wall was washed away in the early hours this morning .
you can find the latest tidal information here .
author: Andrew Segal
BBC Local Live

documents.title: devon travel : tree blocks a3052
text: a fallen tree is blocking about three-quarters of the a3052 , branscombe cross to seaton road .
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: ten devon and cornwall officers 'assaulted at end of 2017 '
text: 10 assaults inflicted on officers in the final week of 2017 , including acts of spitting , kicking an officer whilst driving , pushing and head butting # protecttheprotectors

documents.title: torquay get new eastleigh date
text: torquay united 's home game with eastleigh has been re-arranged for saturday 13 january at 15:00 .
the game was scheduled to be played on new year 's day , but heavy rain waterlogged the pitch at plainmoor .
the gulls are currently bottom of the national league , 10 points from safety .
author: Brent Pilnick
BBC Sport

documents.title: storm eleanor moving towards denmark
text: storm eleanor is now moving towards denmark , so the winds are dying down in this country , weather presenter john kettley says .
`` looking at the wind speeds i might just mention that the 100mph gust that 's been reported was actually at great dun fell , which is standing 847m above sea level .
there ai n't many people who live on great dun fell - a few sheep and a few passing hikers .
`` but there were some very fierce gusts across more populated areas of the south in particular , and a bit of northern ireland and northern england , as we 've seen .
`` there 73mph at raf northolt , just west of london .
that 's actually a pretty fierce gust . ''
author: BBC News

documents.title: devon travel : debris on chulmleigh and beaford roads
text: devon travel : debris on chulmleigh and beaford roads
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: family flees home after sea wall collapse
text: family flees home after sea wall collapse

documents.title: storm eleanor : disruption and homes without power
text: thousands of homes are without power and travel has been disrupted after storm eleanor swept across the uk .
the met office recorded gusts reaching 100mph ( 161km/h ) overnight with a yellow warning still in place for wales , england , most of northern ireland and parts of southern scotland .
more than 1,200 properties in devon , somerset and cornwall were affected by power problems .
the environment agency said the combination of strong winds and high tides could cause some coastal flooding in the uk .
there are more than 40 flood warnings in place in england
the met office 's yellow warning for severe weather is in force until 18:00 .
but forecasters said rain and winds would ease as the day progressed .
author: BBC News UK

documents.title: exmouth slipway closed as weather warning extended
text: east devon council has announced on twitter that due to conditions caused by storm eleanor , the mamhead slipway in exmouth will remain closed for the rest of today .

update for mamhead slipway # exmouth : @ twitterid yellow warning for high wind has been extended until 7pm today - this together with high water at 7.24pm , means that for safety reasons we will not reopen the gates at the slipway today .

documents.title: work to stop portreath debris from causing other damage
text: immediate work after the breach of a harbour wall at portreath includes preventing debris from causing other damage , council contractors say .
cornwall council contractor cormac said about 20m ( 65ft ) of wall was affected by damage from storm eleanor .
its staff are working out what the next steps should be to deal with the breach .
john james , head of service for natural environment at cormac , said that , in the meantime , the company also had `` machinery down there to clear up debris to stop it from flying into houses '' .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: flood warnings remain in place
text: flood warnings remain across # devon & # cornwall ahead of tonight 's high tide .
get the latest : please stay # floodaware

documents.title: council not financially responsible for breached wall
text: cornwall council is not financially responsible for a harbour wall at portreath , which has been breached by bad weather caused by storm eleanor .
john james , from council contractor cormac , said about 20m ( 65ft ) of the wall had been affected .

he said staff had checked the land registry and the unitary authority was not financially responsible for the wall , but staff planned to fix the wall and then deal with cost and ownership issues afterwards .
author: Laurence Reed
BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: extra engineers help deal with devon power problems
text: nearly 300 properties have been recorded as suffering from power problems in devon within the last hour , engineers say .
about 270 customers have been affected in 52 separate incidents across the county because of storm eleanor , western power distribution said .
it added that engineers were working flat out and staff were coming in from other areas to help .
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: storm eleanor : coastguards taking 'precautionary ' measures
text: coastguard teams are being deployed across the south west in `` precautionary measures '' during storm eleanor , a spokesman said .
the ilfracombe team are among a number going out at times of high tide in areas deemed `` high risk '' , to ensure the safety of the public .
a spokesman from the falmouth coastguard team said that the situation is under control , and that media coverage of the weather has led to generally sensible behaviour from the public .
author: Sarah Gosling
BBC News Online

documents.title: structural engineers assess portreath sea wall breach
text: a huge section of sea wall has collapsed in portreath , leaving a row of houses that backs right on to the beach vulnerable to the next high tide , due at about 18:00 .
the people tasked with fixing this are from contractor cormac , whose staff have been working in the village this morning .
john james , head of service for natural environment at cormac , said : `` we 've been down there with structural engineers and a coast protection team .
`` we 've got calls in with specialists to work out what our next steps will be .
`` the most important thing we can do is figure out what we can do to protect the houses that are there . ''

he added that courses of action in the short and medium-term might include moving pieces of the damaged wall back into the gap , the use of `` dumpy bags '' full of material to shore up the wall , and using rock armour to repair the breach and reinforce that work .
author: Laurence Reed
BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: storm eleanor clear-up under way across devon
text: a clear-up is under way after storm eleanor brought down trees across devon , causing powers cuts to hundreds of homes and businesses .
north and mid devon have been worst hit , with about 100 properties in bideford , braunton and chagford having their electricity supplies cut off at one point .
winds of up to 60mph have been reported .
fourteen flood warnings remain in force around the county .
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: stormy weather was 'something exceptional '
text: businesses on the north coast of cornwall are counting the cost of storm eleanor which brought winds of 80mph and brought down part of the harbour wall at portreath .
cornwall fire and rescue service said crews had been out on multiple calls dealing with floods , damage to buildings and fallen trees .
about 165 properties across cornwall remain without power .
western power distribution said it expected problems to be sorted this afternoon .
in portreath , simon gregor , who lives in the row of houses backing right on to the beach , which is no longer protected by the sea wall , said the conditions were `` something exceptional '' .
he said : `` all i heard were strong winds [ through the night ] and i thought my windows might be coming into greet me . ''
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: high tide could cause flooding later
text: strong winds caused by storm eleanor have been causing disruption across the south west .
a number of flood warnings and alerts are in place across devon and cornwall as high tide times approach this evening .
high tide is expected between 17:30 and 19:00 on wednesday and 06:00 and 07:30 on thursday .

alison baptiste , from the environment agency , said : `` we urge people to check their flood risk , prepare for flooding , follow advice from emergency services and never to risk driving through flood water '' .
full details are available from the environment agency website .

documents.title: 'interesting night ' for exeter as it faced storm eleanor
text: 'interesting night ' for exeter as it faced storm eleanor

documents.title: weather : continuing windy and squally showers
text: it will continue windy with some occasionally heavy and squally showers .
there will also be some spells of sunshine and it will become drier as the showers die away this afternoon .
however , cloud and further rain will return to the far west by the end of the day .
strong to severe gale force westerly winds will gust to around 60mph at first , but will steadily ease during the day .
maximum temperature : 11c ( 52f ) .
here , also , are the tide times as communities across the counties try to prevent any problems which could be caused at high tide as a result of storm eleanor .
author: Dan Downs
Weather Forecaster

documents.title: lydford road reopens after storm problems
text: the road through lydford is now open .
thanks to western power for their prompt response , and david hocking and kleen kutt forestry contractors for their tree surgery skills .
# teamwork # stormeleanor

documents.title: drains 'struggling ' after storms and heavy showers
text: some of the showers are heavy & drains are struggling because of debris but they should clear after the showers pass hg

documents.title: st ives seafront gallery suffers storm flood damage
text: a seafront gallery in st ives , cornwall , has suffered some flood damage as a result of storm eleanor .
artwork at porthminster gallery was broken as a result of the weather which has lashed the county 's north coast overnight .
author: Matt Shepherd
BBC South West

documents.title: portreath damage : family see sea wall come down
text: a section of the harbour wall in portreath has been washed away as gales and high seas battered the county .
storm eleanor brought winds of up to 80mph , with the fire service saying they were called out to multiple calls dealing with floods , damage to buildings and fallen trees .
sarah , who lives about 10m from the harbour wall in portreath , said she and her husband decided to get out of the house with their child as the wall was washed away .
she said : `` i was woken up about 05:20 .
my husband was looking out the window and said we should just probably go .
`` we got dressed and took the little one and went out for a bit .
`` he did see the sea wall come down , so he was concerned that , with the power of the waves , we would get flooded . ''
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: 'localised flooding ' expected across south west
text: more flooding is possible across the south west as more heavy rain is expected later .
according to the environment agency , localised river and surface water flooding is possible across devon and cornwall later .
heavy rain is expected tonight , falling on already saturated ground .
flooding is `` expected '' in the areas marked with red warnings , where `` immediate action '' is recommended .
author: Sarah Gosling
BBC News Online

documents.title: brittany ferries ' roscoff sailings cancelled
text: brittany ferries ' plymouth to roscoff sailing tonight and its roscoff to plymouth route on thursday at 22:00 have both been cancelled `` due to adverse weather conditions '' , the company says .
passengers have been advised to contact the company `` for advice and alternatives '' .
it added : `` we apologise for the inconvenience caused . ''
author: Andrew Segal
BBC Local Live

documents.title: 'avoid exposed coasts ' warning
text: please avoid visiting exposed coastal areas today people - the worst of # stormeleanor may have passed but conditions will remain dangerous throughout the rest of the day .
if you see someone in trouble at the coast always dial 999 and ask for coastguard immediately # weatheraware
anchor butter no butts
i was able to watch from a secure position in hastings .
# staysafe # stormeleanor
this is what happens when you try to get your lego ver on a windy day !

documents.title: large beech tree down
text: large beech tree has fallen behind channings wood prison , denbury to west ogwell hg

documents.title: 'devastating weather ' destroys newquay business 's office
text: staff at the business said `` devastating weather '' had caused the damage .
@ twitterid @ twitterid # storm eleanor totally demolished our booking office !
punts !
whole lot is gone !
even the shark head ?
no shark heads home with us we know it 's too windy for her in the winter happy days one shark saved
hi .
it 's andrew from the bbc here .
i hope everybody is safe .
can we use your on this tweet for our local live feed ( with a credit ) ?
and would you be willing to be interviewed by @ twitterid or @ twitterid ?
many thanks .
yes help yourself to if u could credit to newquay sea safaris and fishing please and yes to interview it 's devastating weather again !
i am glad the shark 's head is safe .
keep us updated on your progress to rebuild .
hope to return in summer .
norfolk wildlife rescue @ twitterid
author: Andrew Segal
BBC Local Live

documents.title: video : 'tonnes of masonry ' fall from portreath harbour
text: portreath 's tide-battered harbour wall has partially collapsed as a result of storm eleanor .
police said they were called at about 05:50 after reports of problems .
up to 40ft ( 12m ) of the wall is believed to have been affected .
colin higgs , from portreath harbour committee , said `` hundreds of tonnes of masonry '' from the wall collapsed on to sand below .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: storm spreads debris from perranporth building site
text: large chunks of debris from building site scattered around # perranporth car park , and bridge damaged - river has moved 20m down beach # stormeleanor

documents.title: more than 1,200 properties without power
text: more than 1,200 properties without power in devon , somerset and cornwall , engineers say .
western power distribution said that , as of 10:15 , some 1,213 properties were affected across the counties .
this was made up of :
the largest single incident is in the penzance area , where 172 properties are without power .
engineers said they hoped all those affected would be back online by 13:00 , and the latest updates could be found on its website .
author: BBC Spotlight

documents.title: sea wall damage in portreath
text: sea wall damage in portreath
author: Miles Davis
BBC News Online

documents.title: storm-damaged portreath : harbour wall and shed hit
text: storm eleanor has caused damage to some areas of portreath .
things damaged range from a 30ft ( 9m ) section of the harbour wall to one shed being left with just its roof and floor .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: video : damage to the sea wall in portreath
text: reporter miles davis captured this video showing the damage to the sea wall in portreath .
a 30ft ( 9m ) section of the wall has crashed down on to the sand below .
author: Miles Davis
BBC News Online

documents.title: water crashes over sea wall in ilfracombe
text: charmain lovett captured these of high tide in ilfracombe .
the water flooded a car park and came over the sea wall .
cars outside the admiral collingwood pub were surrounded by water too .
author: Sian Davies
BBC News Online

text: cornwall travel : storm eleanor fells trees

documents.title: 'keep away from water 's edge ' warning
text: 06:06 - flooding - we were mobilised to flooding in beach road .
the high tide and strong winds caused the water to breach the sea wall .
a further high tide is expected tonight and tomorrow morning .
members of the public are advised to keep well away from the waters edge .
hi team , would it be ok for us to use your photo on our website with a credit please ?
yes that 's not a problem
@ twitterid @ twitterid # willowbistro thanks for your help this morning

documents.title: devon travel : storm damage cause problems county-wide
text: devon travel : storm damage cause problems county-wide
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: flight from exeter cancelled due to weather conditions
text: the flybe flight from exeter to guernsey and jersey has now been cancelled .
flybe said it was due to conditions in the channel islands and passengers were being rebooked on future flights .
author: Jen Smith
BBC Channel Islands

documents.title: council staff dispatched to deal with storm-hit trees
text: hundreds of homes across devon are still without power after storm eleanor swept across the county overnight .
western power said it was dealing with 32 incidents , affecting about 400 customers .
the worst affected area is mid devon .
winds of up to 60 mph have brought down trees and led to coastal flooding , particularly around north devon .
hugh griffith , from devon highways control at county hall in exeter , said staff were now being dispatched to deal with fallen trees .
he said : `` now that there 's daylight , we can get some surgeons to some of the bigger trees - the ones we could n't do in the dark hours .
`` hopefully we 'll get these cleared quite quickly . ''
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: 'hundreds of tonnes ' fall in portreath harbour wall crash
text: numerous reports are coming of flooding and damage to buildings as storm eleanor continues to affect cornwall .
earlier , gusts of up to 80mph were recorded at seven stones , off the cornwall coast , about 200 homes were without power , and numerous trees have been brought down on roads .
the north coast has taken the brunt of the storm .
in portreath , a 30ft section of the harbour wall has been washed away , and police and workers from cornwall council contractor cormac are on the scene .
colin higgs , from portreath harbour committee , said the wall collapsed on to what was a crazy golf course .
he said : `` hundreds of tonnes masonry have crashed on to the sand below . ''
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: bistro damaged by dirty water and debris
text: this video shows the damage to the willow bistro in perranporth at high tide this morning .
owner janine branch shot the footage as her business was damaged by storms .
author: Miles Davis
BBC News Online

documents.title: damage in perranporth
text: storm eleanor has caused damage to the willow bistro in perranporth .
owner janine branch took these as water encroached on the building this morning at high tide .
a flood board gave way and dirty water and debris has entered the restaurant .
author: Miles Davis
BBC News Online

documents.title: tree falls on power lines
text: a road has been closed in lydford in devon due to a tree falling on power lines .
school lane is blocked near the a386 due to the fallen tree .
tree on the power lines at lydford .
road closed , please use alternative routes .
author: Sian Davies
BBC News Online

documents.title: fire crew makes safe swept away trampoline
text: launceston fire station says it is not just flooding problems it has been dealing with as storm eleanor hits the county .
the station tweeted that it had been called to `` make safe a trampoline that had been blown into a tree after high winds '' .
incident : 1 appliance called to make safe a trampoline that had been blown into a tree after last nights high winds by # stormeleanor # notjustfires
oh dear !
whereabouts ?
author: Andrew Segal
BBC Local Live

documents.title: storm eleanor brings wind , flooding and hail to devon
text: hundreds of homes across devon are without power after storm eleanor swept across the county overnight .
winds of up to 60 mph have brought down trees and led to coastal flooding , with north and east devon worst hit .
the environment agency said waves of up to 42ft ( 13m ) had been recorded around the south west coast .
hugh griffith , from devon county control in exeter , said his team had dealt with `` lots of calls '' with `` fallen tree and some flooding issues as showers and winds pass through the county '' .
he added : `` we 've got some very gusty conditions up in the north devon area .
people must take care .
`` we 've also had a hail shower up on dartmoor , and that 's dropped the road surface temperature , so it could be a bit tricky up there . ''
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: storm eleanor causes more than 30 devon power incidents
text: there are 32 separate power supply incidents across devon at the moment , affecting about 400 customers .
a lot of the incidents related to wind-born debris and some of that has brought down conductors , western power distribution said .
the worst affected area is mid devon and the utility firm is now moving teams from less urgent areas into the area .
it said it hoped the power would not be off beyond lunchtime .
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: tide-battered portreath harbour wall partially collapses
text: a tide-battered harbour wall in cornwall partially collapsed as storm eleanor intensified on wednesday morning , police said .
devon and cornwall police said they were called to portreath at about 05:50 due to a very high tide and water coming on to the road .
closer to shore , cracks began to form in the harbour wall and water poured through it , while some steps collapsed .
police said a 25ft ( 7m ) to 30ft ( 9m ) section was later swept further out to sea .
they added : `` there is no risk to anybody .
highways england are putting bags along the road and there are barriers up as well . ''
picture : portreath studio
# portreath this morning after # stormeleanor destroyed a forty foot section of the harbour wall - collapsing onto the site of the old crazy golf site
crazy golf has just become more crazier ! !
more on storms with me at lunchtime !
author: Andrew Segal
BBC Local Live

documents.title: portreath harbour wall 'taken out '
text: portreath wall has been taken out .
our dave was down there early this morning .
@ piratefm @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid

documents.title: damage in perranporth following storm
text: as well as damage to the willow bistro , perranporth has seen debris left on roads and a damaged footbridge .
miles davis has sent these from the scene .
author: Miles Davis
BBC News Online

documents.title: storm eleanor 'pops ' perranporth restaurant flood defences
text: a perranporth restaurant is cleaning up flood damage after water managed to get through its flood defences .
willow bistro owner janine branch said : `` a flood board gave way .
there was just too much water .
`` they 've been good for the past few years , but there were too many waves . ''
she said the business saw about 2ft of water come into it .
she said : `` we 're bailing out now .
the water 's so dirty this time , there 's so much debris .
`` the pressure popped one of the seals on one of the biggest flood boards .
once that happened , that was it - there was a deluge of water into the restaurant .
`` it 's four years to the day since the last time we were flooded .
`` the drains and pumping stations are full , so there 's nowhere for water to go .
it 's mother nature at its best . ''
she added that the business was currently closed but it still hoped to reopen as planned in mid-february .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: hundreds of homes across devon without power
text: hundreds of homes across devon are without power this morning after storm eleanor swept across the county , bringing with it 60mph winds and flooding .
more than 100 properties in chagford and 94 homes in sidmouth have lost their supply , with people in okehampton and silverton also reporting issues with their electricity .
north and east devon have been worst hit , with trees down in ottery st mary , bideford and stoke cannon .
the taw bridge in barnstaple is also closed to high-sided vehicles due to the strong winds , with a flood warning in place across the north coast , including the taw torridge estuary .
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: more than 170 properties in cornwall without power
text: some 171 properties in cornwall are without power , mainly in the east of the county .
western power distribution said that earlier problems in the west of the county have been fixed .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: cornwall firefighters attend 'multiple ' storm incidents
text: firefighters in cornwall say they have attended `` multiple incidents '' of flooded properties and `` dangerous structures blowing in the wind '' as a result of storm eleanor .

cornwall fire and rescue service said : `` with met office forecasts of strong winds and heavy rain due to affect cornwall over the coming hours , cornwall fire and rescue service is warning residents and visitors to be prepared and take precautions where necessary . ''
author: Andrew Segal
BBC Local Live

documents.title: wave heights of up to 30ft monitored at sea
text: these are the wave heights which have been recorded by the seven stones wave monitoring buoy , which is between lands end and the isles of scilly .
we have seen regular gusts of 70mph as a result of storm eleanor , but there have been some of up to 80mph .
the storm is moving towards the north sea , but there are still some heavy seas , and parts of the coastline could still be quite a dangerous place to be for a while .

BBC Weather Forecaster

documents.title: storm 'moving out to north sea '
text: the centre of # stormeleanor is now moving out into the north sea , but it will remain very windy in many areas .
yellow warnings remain in force
hi , we hope that naming storms will help raise awareness of severe weather events and ensure greater safety of the public .
more info here : ^rachael
1/2.well it 's not .
it 's just turning it into a media circus !
naming them has no relevance .
surveys conducted after named storms in 2016/17 have shown increases in awareness and action taken in response to people hearing of a named storm .
storm doris for example achieved an 89 % awareness score with 1/2
rubbish .
absolute rubbish .
why has n't the other storm following eleanor got a name ?
freddi for example ?
hi stewart .
the criteria we use for naming storms is based on our national severe weather warnings service .
this is based on a combination of both the impact the weather may have , and the likelihood of 1/2

documents.title: about 500 homes without power in devon
text: about 500 homes in devon are without power this morning as storm eleanor brings winds of up to 60mph across the county .
east and north devon have been worst hit , with trees down in ottery st mary , sidmouth and stoke cannon .
a thunderstorm in exeter at 02:00 has brought down a large tree on alphington road , near the railway bridge .
the taw bridge in barnstaple is closed to high sided vehicles due to the strong winds , with flood warnings in place across the north coast , including the taw torridge estuary .
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: weather : very windy today with blustery showers
text: storm eleanor will bring very strong winds today , with large waves in coastal areas , especially along the north coast of devon and cornwall .
scattered blustery showers will push in too , with some drier and brighter spells in between .
maximum temperature : 11c ( 52f )
author: BBC Weather
